titlestmt.titleproper: W G. Phillips & Bros. account book 1849-1876 1849-1868
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: W G. Phillips & Bros. account book
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: W G. Phillips & Bros. was a firm of seed merchants in Wilmington, Delaware.

scopecontent.p: This volume is an account book of goods and services related to the operation of Cahall Farm from 1849 to 1868. Entries include expenses (and some credits) for labor, lumber, hardware, interest payments, advertising, molasses, grain and other crops. There is also some information on planting of crops and a few agricultural newspaper clippings. Two loose invoices for rail freight and seeds are inserted in the volume.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Delaware: Torbert-Ellegood collection.
